main event: Multiple UFO sightings in the Penbrook, Pennsylvania area in July 1955, with reports of saucer-shaped objects, hovering, rapid acceleration, and erratic motion.
interesting points: Mrs. Edward Supe, a supervisor of the 648th AC&W Squadron, reported sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) and expressed willingness to cooperate in further investigations.
Multiple witnesses provided descriptions of round, glowing, and multi-colored light-emitting objects, causing rapid acceleration and hovering above trees before disappearing.
The sightings were investigated by Major Charles Ley and other USAF personnel who requested additional information due to insufficient data submitted.
Witnesses described a 30-foot diameter silver object in flight that took off in a straight line and disappeared rapidly, leaving behind a square of cardboard with pebbles on it.
There were also reports of a hovering oval object and a report submitted by Dr. L. Accosta detailing a sighting in Camp Hill, Penbrook, PA in August 1953.
sighted object: saucer-shaped objects, round, glowing, multi-colored light-emitting objects
witnesses: Multiple witnesses including Mrs. Edward Supe, Lucille Long, and others
photographs: no photographs mentioned in the reports
